info.game_comments:
2012 Kids Week game 5.
Last game of Season 28.

(1, 1).clue: You & your friends can gape at the animals at the Central Park this, where "Madagascar" is set

(2, 1).clue: On July 9, 2011 this shortstop became the first player to reach 3,000 career hits as a Yankee

(3, 1).clue: This desert covers much of the African country of Mali

(4, 1).clue: To close one eye; it can be used as a signal, like to mean "I'm not really serious"

(5, 1).clue: This plaything consists of a pole with foot rests & a strong spring; you work it by bouncing up & down

(6, 1).clue: To offer money for something at an auction

(1, 2).clue: This party place "where a kid can be a kid" used to have "pizza" in its name, now all that's left is the "cheese"

(2, 2).clue: In 2005, she became the first woman to lead a lap in the Indianapolis 500

(3, 2).clue: It's the only country Portugal borders

(4, 2).clue: People will understand your writing better if you put this, also called a full stop, at the end of each sentence

(5, 2).clue: The 2 iron stakes on the pitching court of this game are 40 feet apart

(6, 2).clue: Fast mover of the deep with 10 arms

(1, 3).clue: Amaze your guests in the TImes Square home of Ripley's Believe It or Not--this type of place but starting with "oddi", not "audi"

(2, 3).clue: In 2012 he was the talk of the NBA with 136 points in his first 5 starts for the Knicks

(3, 3).clue: From about 60 miles away, Mount Fuji towers over this capital city

(4, 3).clue: Doing this with 2 fingers in your mouth is an old-fashioned but effective way to hail a taxi

(5, 3).clue: This version of jump rope requires 2 people twirling 2 ropes, one clockwise, one counter-clockwise

(1, 4).clue: Celebs like Demi Lovato have celebrated their birthdays at Pinz, whose name tells you it's a venue for this game

(2, 4).clue: In 2000 they became the only sisters in Olympic history to win gold in women's doubles in tennis

(3, 4).clue: Cities in this country include Chennai & Mumbai, formerly Madras & Bombay

(4, 4).clue: He was only 15 when he developed his system of writing for the blind

(5, 4).clue: Violations in this game include stepping onto an opponent's half of the pole & striking the rope instead of the ball

(6, 4).clue: To slip sideways on a road

(1, 5).clue: At Bounce U this word meaning "designed to be filled with air" is both a noun & an adjective

(2, 5).clue: This snowboarding champion is known as the "Flying Tomato" for his long red hair

(3, 5).clue: The 224-mile-long Shannon River flows through this country

(4, 5).clue: This 5-letter service that lets you video chat with faraway grandmas over the Internet is part of Microsoft

(5, 5).clue: A standard croquet course may have 6 or 9 of these metal hoops

(6, 5).clue: An arrangement of straight lines that cross each other to form squares

(1, 1).clue: A type of beetle is named for this outer covering of tree trunks, which it damages

(2, 1).clue: The 2011 movie "Soul Surfer" tells the heroic tale of Bethany Hamilton, who was attacked by one of these

(3, 1).clue: The last flight of one of these took place with the launch of the Atlantis on July 8, 2011

(4, 1).clue: These one-eyed giants forged Zeus' thunderbolts

(5, 1).clue: This stretchy one-piece garment for both sexes was named for a guy, a French acrobat

(6, 1).clue: A peach is covered with it

(1, 2).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew delivers the clue from Costa Rica.) The chestnut mandible type of this tropical bird has what looks like a disproportionately large bill, but it's actually lightweight & mostly hollow

(2, 2).clue: On Nick 12-year-old Aang must overcome the ruthless fire nation as The "Last" this

(3, 2).clue: In 2006 she became Alaska's first female governor

(4, 2).clue: Daedalus built this maze that confined the Minotaur, but was later imprisoned in it himself

(5, 2).clue: In the ballet "Checkmate", the red one of these gets to die an agonizing death at the hands of the black queen

(6, 2).clue: Jade, Cloe, Sasha & Yasmin were the first 4 of these fashion dolls

(1, 3).clue: Take 2 letters out of Barracudina to get this better-known predatory fish

(2, 3).clue: This youngest member of "The Incredibles" doesn't show any superpowers until Syndrome tries to abduct him

(3, 3).clue: On Jan. 15, 2006 NASA's Stardust spacecraft, having "tailed" this type of celestial body, came back with dust from it

(4, 3).clue: Only this one of the 3 Gorgons was mortal; Perseus killed her

(5, 3).clue: Boys' classes often emphasize jumps, maybe even the difficult tour en l'air, which means this in the air

(6, 3).clue: A ballroom dance, it can also mean something that can be accomplished with little effort

(1, 4).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew delivers the clue from the Harvard Museum of Natural History in Boston Massachusetts) Discovered in 1935, a skull at the Harvard Museum of Natural History is called a type specimen, as it helped paleontologists establish this type of dinosaur

(2, 4).clue: "Number 6" shows up to help the title alien in this movie that features otherworldly superteens

(3, 4).clue: Name of the man seen here who has presided over the U.S. Senate since 2009

(4, 4).clue: Poets gave this name to Amor, the winged boy god of love

(5, 4).clue: A boy named Fritz breaks this title gift given to his sister Clara by Drosselmeyer

(6, 4).clue: Varieties of this round snack cracker made by Nabisco include whole wheat & honey butter

(1, 5).clue: In 2011 a "lone" one of these predators crossed from Oregon to become California's first wild one since 1924

(2, 5).clue: Taylor Lautner & Taylor Dooley play these imaginary heroes who come alive to fight Mr. Electric in a 2005 film

(3, 5).clue: In 2009 Mahmoud Ahmadinejad defeated Mir Hossein Moussavi to win re-election as president of this country

(5, 5).clue: After a performance, ballerinas curtsy; men perform a small one of these equivalent gestures

(6, 5).clue: As a verb it can mean to move swiftly; as a noun, it's one who has remarkable skill

(0, 0).clue: This country in the Americas has more than 125,000 miles of coastline, the most of any country in the world
